100.NAME: Continue
100.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The initial part of the request has been received. You can continue by sending the remainder of the request

200.NAME: OK
200.GET: An entity corresponding to the requested resource is sent in the response
200.HEAD: The entity-header fields corresponding to the requested resource are sent in the response without any message-body
200.POST: An entity describing or containing the result of the action
200.TRACE: An entity containing the request message as received by the end server

202.NAME: Accepted
202.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed

203.NAME: Non-Authoritative Information
203.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The returned metainformation in the entity-header is not the definitive

204.NAME: No Content
204.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server has fulfilled the request

205.NAME: Reset Content
205.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server has fulfilled the request and resetted the document view

206.NAME: Partial Content
206.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server has fulfilled the partial request

300.NAME: Multiple Choices
300.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The requested resource corresponds to any one of a set of representations

301.NAME: Moved Permanently
301.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URI and any future references to this resource should use one of the returned URIs

302.NAME: Found
302.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The requested resource resides temporarily under a different URI

303.NAME: See Other
303.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The response to the request can be found under a different URI and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource

304.NAME: Not Modified
304.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The document request has not been modified

305.NAME: Use Proxy
305.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by the Location field

307.NAME: Temporary Redirect
307.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The requested resource resides temporarily under a different URI. Since the redirection may be altered on occasion, the client should continue to use the Request-URI for future requests

400.NAME: Bad Request
400.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax

403.NAME: Forbidden
403.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

404.NAME: Not Found
404.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.

405.NAME: Method Not Allowed
405.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The method specified in the Request-Line is not allowed for the resource identified by the Request-URI. The response must include an Allow header containing a list of valid methods for the requested resource.

406.NAME: Not Acceptable
406.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request.

407.NAME: Proxy Authentication Required
407.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

408.NAME: Request Timeout
408.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait.

409.NAME: Conflict
409.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource

410.NAME: Gone
410.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known

411.NAME: Length Required
411.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server refuses to accept the request without a defined Content-Length

412.NAME: Precondition Failed
412.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The precondition given in one or more of the request-header fields evaluated to false when it was tested on the server.

413.NAME: Request Entity Too Large
413.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server is refusing to process a request because the request entity is larger than the server is willing or able to process

414.NAME: Request-URI Too Long
414.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret

415.NAME: Unsupported Media Type
415.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The entity of the request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method

416.NAME: Requested Range Not Satisfiable
416.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The request included a Range request-header field and none of the range-specifier values in this field overlap the current extent of the selected resource

417.NAME: Expectation Failed
417.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The expectation given in an Expect request-header field could not be met by this server

500.NAME: Internal Server Error
500.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the request

501.NAME: Not Implemented
501.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request

502.NAME: Bad Gateway
502.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server received an invalid response from the upstream server it accessed in attempting to fulfill the request.

503.NAME: Service Unavailable
503.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server is currently unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server

504.NAME: Gateway Timeout
504.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server did not receive a timely response from the upstream server specified by the URI (e.g. HTTP, FTP, LDAP) or some other auxiliary server (e.g. DNS) it needed to access in attempting to complete the request.

505.NAME: HTTP Version Not Supported
505.DEFAULT_MESSAGE: The server does not support, or refuses to support, the HTTP protocol version that was used in the request message
